Last weekend, Republicans gathered in New Orleans for the Southern Republican Leadership Conference to hear from Michael Steele, Newt Gingrich, Mike Pence and Sarah Palin, among others, from men and women who shape the party's platform and some of whom may have an eye on the GOP nomination for president in 2012.
One of them, Ron Paul, encouraged Republicans to narrow what he called a credibility gap.
We talk a good game, but when we get the chance to do something, we haven't done the job that we should have.
At the end of the conference, there was a straw poll.

We want to hear from Republicans in our audience.
Who's your candidate for 2012?
Email us, talk@npr.org.
